reviewText:
This game is now way better than when it was on beta test.

It's a tower-defence game that you can build towers, roam around ,kill mobs and collecting loot to survive.
I love the concept of the game.
The graphic is making progress on improvement right now, looks good,
Hope the game will runs more smoothly in the following patches.(Can be just because I'm using laptop though...)

reviewText:
Title: Abyss Raiders: Uncharted
Genre: Action, Adventure, Indie, Strategy
Developer: DarkStar Games
Publisher: DarkStar Games
Release Date30 Apr, 2015

Gameplay
This isn't a bad game to look at, though one of the things that annoyed me about this straight away was the controls and movement. They're bad and clumsy, and I can guarentee you'll be spending quite a chunk of your time spinning and positioning yourself perfectly like an idiot and moving the camera alongside it to try and find what is happening. The game has thirty levels, and I don't think you'll be wanting to reach the end any time soon.

Pros

Graphics are oke"

Music is good
date:
fits the mood of the game

Cons

You can't change the controls in game or pause
The controls
THE CONTROLS
OH GOD THE CONTROLS
Game feels unfinished
Seems buggy and glitchy

TL;DR

Overall Verdict
No. This is a bad game. I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who likes tower defense at all.
this game HAD potential if they would have finished it. This feel so unfinished...

If you'd like to read more reviews from me

reviewText:
A free roam tower defence in a post apocalyptic subterranean world. Control a robot helper named Ada. Guide her to her end goal.
Survive waves of robot monsters by building several types of gun turrets around crystals. Your handgun has a limited use before it needs to recharge. Find forgotten chests with materials inside. Use a decoy to buy some time.

https://youtu.be/Xw6p_c-Gnps

reviewText:
Sadly, what could be a great game has too many issues.

As others have mentioned, the controls are a major culprit, and it can be difficult to control your character when you have to pass underneath something - completely blind, mind.

It feels more like an early access proof of concept, but if it were cleaned up it could be great.

reviewText: Bottom line is that the controls and interface are terrible and make this game rather bad. If the controls and interface were improved it would be quite a good game. As it is, I was often shooting in a direction where my mouse wasn't pointing. And why oh why can WASD not be used ?! It forces mouse controls when it really shouldn't have. You can't even press escape during a level. The English in game isn't great. The game needs a tutorial.\n\nThe graphics are okay and the music is quite good and appropriate, but that's all I can speak about positively.
